text:
- ( bell rings )
- Let's take five, everybody.
When we have a break on set--
There's no time to rest.
Mic drop.

This next question is
how do you take a stand

- and stand up for yourself?
- I love this question.

And just like Sydney,
I think it's very important

to stand up
for what you believe in,

even if it means
you might feel vulnerable.

Ava: I love the way that
Sydney stood up for herself.

She wasn't afraid to fight
for what was right.

- When just one...
- Or two.

Ruth:
...people stand up together,

it could go viral
and inspire everyone.

And also,
it's okay to talk it out.

You might have
to try different ways

to get people
to see your point of view.

I like to use something
called "I statements,"
like "I think" or "I feel."
It's a way to own your feelings
and your position on things.

Sometimes it's really hard
to stand up for yourself.

But when you feel like
you're falling,

having a friend to help keep you
on your feet is everything.

Man: Ruth,
you're back on in two.
Oh, don't worry, Ruth.

I'll go ahead
and stand in for you.
Man: You, too, Ava.

- See you soon.
- Bye-bye!

Keep watching
"Sydney To The Max"...
On Disney Channel.
